problems.title: Minimum Cost Climbing Stairs
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array cost[] where cost[i] is the cost of stepping on the i-th stair.
Once you pay the cost, you can climb either 1 or 2 steps.

You can start from either step 0 or step 1.
Find the minimum cost to reach the top of the floor (past the last step).
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3
10 15 20

Sample Output
15

Explanation:
Start at step 1, pay 15, jump 2 steps to the top.
Total cost = 15

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def minCostClimbingStairs(self, cost):

        # dp[i] = cost[i] + min(dp[i-1], dp[i-2])
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    cost = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.minCostClimbingStairs(cost))

hintsList: To reach step i, you must come from step i-1 or i-2. Choose the minimum cost path.
dp[i] = cost[i] + min(dp[i-1], dp[i-2]). Final answer is min(dp[n-1], dp[n-2]) to go past the last step.
